title: Oldrich Lipsky - Lemonade Joe (1964)
description:
Lemonade Joe is another great find from the immensely entertaining Czech New Wave. Director Lipsky threw singing cowboy films, Dudley Doright, and Marx (Karl, that is) in a blender, hit pulp, and poured out a delicious candy-colored malt that is far from perfect, but certainly a sight to see. This is definitely one for the ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œI have never seen anything quite like that beforeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ category.

Karel Fiala stars as the titular hero, Kolaloka lemonade advocate and the straight-shootinÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢est cowboy around. The action is set in a fictional Arizona, where Doug Badman, owner of the Trigger Whisky saloon, controls a small town, and entertains himself by sponsoring saloon girl musical numbers and what may be the longest craziest bar brawl of all time. When BadmanÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s glass-eating thug menaces temperance crusader Ezra Goodman, and his luscious daughter Winnifred, Lemonade Joe shows up to save the day in his own inimitable style. JoeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s arrival sets off a moderately vicious battle for the minds (and wallets) of the townÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s residents between GoodmanÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s newly founded Kolaloka outlet, and BadmanÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s depraved whisky den. Events are complicated by the arrival of Doug BadmanÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s even worse brother Horace Badman, and by Tornado Lou, the local torch singer, who has been waiting for a champion like Joe and does not want competition from the demure Winnifred.
